Charles Town is a city in Jefferson County, in the Washington-Arlington metro area.

It is the county seat.

The community was named for settler Charles Washington, brother of President George Washington.

The latitude of Charles Town is 39.288N. The longitude is -77.86W.
It is in the Eastern Standard time zone. Elevation is 512 feet.

The estimated population, in 2003, was 3,180.

Nestled in the Eastern Panhandle of West Virginia, Jefferson County Parks and Recreation Commission (JCPRC)

owns or operates eight county parks, comprising of over 250 acres of land, located throughout the county.  The parks boast of varied facilities, including picnic areas, athletic fields, tennis courts, nature trails, and playgrounds.  The JCPRC strives to provide the best facilities for all residents to use and enjoy.
